meanings.definition: In the direction from which the wind is blowing.
meanings.sent1: The sailboat sailed upwinds towards the shore.
meanings.sent2: The birds flew effortlessly upwinds, carried by the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The kite soared upwinds, almost as if it was chasing the clouds.
meanings.sent4: The leaves rustled upwinds, dancing in the gentle air currents.
meanings.sent5: The wind chimes sang upwinds, creating a melodious tune.

meanings.definition: Moving or situated in an upward direction relative to the wind.
meanings.sent1: The upwinds current lifted the glider higher into the sky.
meanings.sent2: The hot air balloon drifted gracefully in the upwinds sky.
meanings.sent3: The upwinds mountain path offered a challenging but rewarding hike.
meanings.sent4: The upwinds breeze carried the scent of flowers from the valley.
meanings.sent5: The upwinds clouds painted a beautiful picture against the blue sky.
